required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Study Drug With Placebo and Haloperidol in Patients With Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: A 6-Week, Double-Blind, Randomized, Fixed-Dose, Parallel-Group Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Three Dose Levels of SM-13496 Compared to Placebo and Haloperidol in Patients With Schizophrenia Who Are Experiencing an Acute Exacerbation of Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of the drug SM-13496 compared to a placebo and to haloperidol in patients with schizophrenia.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Treatment in the BPRS (Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale)Total Score
primary_outcome.description: The BPRS consists of 18 ordered categorical items (from "not present" to "extremely severe," on a 1- to 7-point scale), each developed to assess patient symptomatology in a relatively discrete symptom area. The BPRS will be extracted from the PANSS by adding the scores of the 18 items (P2 to P7, N1, N2, and G1 to G10) of the PANSS and will not be assessed separately. The minimum score on the BPRS is 18 and the maximum is 126. The higher number indicates a worsening of schizophrenia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Treatment in the PANSS (Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale) Scores
secondary_outcome.description: The PANSS Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale)is a 30-item scale that evaluates positive, negative, and other symptoms in patients with schizophrenia. Each item is rated on a 7-point scale that ranges from 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme). Scores range from 30-210 with higher scores representing a worsening of schizophrenia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Treatment in the CGI-S (Clinical Global Impression of Severity) Scores
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI Severity (CGI-S) assesses the severity of illness of the patient relative to the particular population on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Treatment in the MADRS (Montgomery Asberg-Depression Scale) Scores
secondary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a 10-item rating scale that assesses apparent and reported sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty in concentration, and lack of interest. Each item is scored on a 7-point scale with a score of 0 reflecting no symptoms and a score of 6 reflecting symptoms of maximum severity.

arm_group.description: Matching Placebo to Lurasidone and Haloperidol

intervention.description: Matching Placebo to Lurasdione and Haloperidol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- The patient has a primary diagnosis of schizophrenia
- The patient has been hospitalized with acute or relapsing schizophrenia within 3 weeks of screening
- The patient has had a duration of illness of at least one year.
- The patient has a BPRS score of at least 42 at baseline and a score of at least 4 in two or more items of the positive symptom subcluster on the PANSS
- The patient is able to remain off antipsychotic medication for a 4 day washout period
Exclusion criteria:
- The patient has had psychiatric hospitalizations other than current hospitalizations within 1 month prior to screening.
- The patient is considered treatment resistant-Substance abuse-Prolactin level of > 200 ng/mL at baseline
- Pregnancy

facility.name: Albert Einstein Medical Center - Dept. of Psychiatry

group.title: 20 mg
group.description: Lurasidone 20 mg oral tablet taken once a day. The number of subjects in the participant flow for the lurasidone 20mg group(overall study) is based on the total number of subjects randomized in this treatment group.

group.title: 40 mg
group.description: Lurasidone 40 mg oral tablet taken once a day. The number of subjects in the participant flow for the lurasidone 40mg group(overall study) is based on the total number of subjects randomized in this treatment group.

group.title: 80 mg
group.description: Lurasidone 80 mg oral tablet taken once a day. The number of subjects in the participant flow for the lurasidone 80mg group(overall study) is based on the total number of subjects randomized in this treatment group.

group.title: 10 mg Haloperidol
group.description: 10 mg Haloperidol overencapsulated tablet taken orally once a day. The number of subjects in the participant flow for the haloperidol 10mg group(overall study) is based on the total number of subjects randomized in this treatment group.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Oral Capsule matching treatment group taken oce a day. The number of subjects in the participant flow for the placebo group(overall study) is based on the total number of subjects randomized in this treatment group.

group.title: 20 mg
group.description: Lurasidone 20 mg oral tablet taken once a day

group.title: 40 mg
group.description: Lurasidone 40 mg oral tablet taken once a day. The number of subjects in the participant flow (overall study) is based on the total number of subjects randomized (356). The number of subjects in the baseline characteristics is based on the safety population (353). All randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study medication were included in the safety analysis. Two subjects who were randomized to the 40 mg treatment group did not take any study medication.

group.title: 80 mg
group.description: Lurasidone 80 mg oral tablet taken once a day

group.title: 10 mg Haloperidol
group.description: 10 mg Haloperidol overencapsulated tablet taken orally once a day. The number of subjects in the participant flow (overall study) is based on the total number of subjects randomized (356). The number of subjects in the baseline characteristics is based on the safety population (353). All randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study medication were included in the safety analysis. One subject who was randomized to the 10 mg haloperidol treatment group did not take any study medication.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Oral Capsule matching treatment group taken oce a day

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Treatment in the BPRS (Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale)Total Score
outcome.description: The BPRS consists of 18 ordered categorical items (from "not present" to "extremely severe," on a 1- to 7-point scale), each developed to assess patient symptomatology in a relatively discrete symptom area. The BPRS will be extracted from the PANSS by adding the scores of the 18 items (P2 to P7, N1, N2, and G1 to G10) of the PANSS and will not be assessed separately. The minimum score on the BPRS is 18 and the maximum is 126. The higher number indicates a worsening of schizophrenia.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Division of Neuropharmacological Drug Products Last Observation Carried Forward (ITT-DNDP-LOCF). The ITT-DNDP-LOCF population will include all randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and who had at least one efficacy evaluation at Day 3 or beyond, during the double-blind treatment period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
